page.title: 09THE ECOLOGY OF WINCHESTER
page.content: The soil in this area is an alkaline chalky soil. Most of the wild flowers and{trees}are alkaline loving plants. The beech tree grows exceptionally well in the chalky soil. A lot of the hedgerows in the area are hawthorn, which also grows very well in chalk. Milk wort, cowslips, rock roses, eye bright, twayblade and salad burnet are all alkaline loving{plants}and are found in abundance. Scabious and hare bells are also chalk loving plants, but are often hidden by long grasses like quaking grass.Often bluebells are found underneath beach trees where wildlife such as rabbits, roe deer, squirrels and a few foxes live. The farming land in this area is used for arable crops, particularly barley. Recent road-building on the M3 motorway has brought conservation much to our minds.
